newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-SANCHEZ PUTS FEYENOORD LEVEL WITH LEADERS PSV.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SANCHEZ PUTS FEYENOORD LEVEL WITH LEADERS PSV.

text.p: Argentine striker Pablo Sanchez scored both goals as Feyenoord beat bottom club NEC Nijmegen 2-0 to go level on points with Dutch league leaders PSV Eindhoven on Saturday.
The Rotterdammers have 51 points from 23 matches, but PSV could take a clear lead when they travel to play 16th-placed RKC Waalwijk on Sunday.
Sanchez, eligible to play despite being sent off against Ajax last week, opened the score in the 44th minute of a lacklustre match, when he headed home a Giovanni van Bronckhorst cross.
Four minutes after halftime, Sanchez scored his second from close range, plunging NEC to their ninth defeat in a row.
Fortuna Sittard celebrated their first home victory of the season and their first win in the current campaign by more than one goal with a 2-0 success over Willem II Tilburg.
Robert van der Weert and Englishman Michael Jeffrey were the scorers for Sittard.
